newsitem.title: GERMANY: Nov pan-German CPI inflation falls to 1.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Nov pan-German CPI inflation falls to 1.4 pct.

text.p: German consumer price inflation fell in November to 1.4 percent year-on-year from 1.5 percent the previous month, data from the Federal Statistics Office showed on Tuesday.

The data also confirmed earlier preliminary figures showing a similar drop in west German inflation to 1.4 percent from 1.5 percent, while prices rose in the east by 1.6 percent after 1.5 percent in October.
November prices fell 0.1 percent against the previous month in Germany as a whole, after remaining unchanged in October.

A breakdown of the components of the consumer price basket showed that the strongest monthly fall came in energy prices, excluding fuels, which fell by 0.9 percent after a rise of 1.3 percent in October.
Also sharply lower in November, by 2.2 percent, were prices for personal equipment. Most other categories showed modest rises, the statistics office said.
